title: India extends policy to import refined palm oil at lower duty
summary: India has extended its policy allowing imports of refined palm oil at reduced duty rates and approved duty-free imports of 51,000 tonnes of cotton for 2023, according to a government notification.
content:
By Rajendra Jadhav

MUMBAI, Dec 29 (Reuters) - India extended a policy to import refined palm oil at a lower duty and allowed imports of 51,000 tonnes of cotton at nil duty in 2023, the government said in a notification late on Thursday.

The concession on palm oil imports comes as a relief for refiners in South Asian countries and overseas suppliers, while the duty-free cotton imports will help textile manufacturers secure supplies at lower costs.

markdown_content:
## Import Policy Updates

MUMBAI, Dec 29 (Reuters) - India extended a policy to import refined palm oil at a lower duty and allowed imports of 51,000 tonnes of cotton at nil duty in 2023, the government said in a notification late on Thursday.

The concession on palm oil imports comes as a relief for refiners in South Asian countries and overseas suppliers, while the duty-free cotton imports will help textile manufacturers secure supplies at lower costs.
